page.title: 02STOCK FARMING/S.ELKINGTON
page.content: G.& B.Dobson Ltd. have 350 Friesian/ Hereford breeding heifers on 200 hectares of chiefly permanent grassland with woodside shelter. Simental or Blonde Aquitaine bulls used to produce a small 1st calf, Charolais used later.A few Lincoln Reds kept for nostalgic reasons. From 6 mths bull calves left entire,fed concentrates indoors,fattened to slaughter at 13 mths.75% of straw from arable acreage is used either as feed 5ft.sq.bales having been ammonia treated and cooked in ovens,or used as bedding for crew yards in winter. The manure is eventually spread on the land. Several riding horses kept. One full time, and 2 part-time gaffmen or stock men employed, and also a groom. {
